title: Water Asset Management funds correspondence

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax



Confidentiality: The information contained in this e-mail and any attachment(s) hereto is confidential and may be legally privileged. communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.title: image002
files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

MuckRock Staff

communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

title: Finish Line Grant Program

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Finish Line Grant Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A spreadsheet or other record identifying all the recipients of the Finish Line Grant, including address and amount, since the program's launch.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Mondry

communications.subject: Re: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Finish Line Grant Program
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting the Detroit Land Bank Authority’s Freedom of Information Office. Your FOIA request is deemed received today, November 21, 2024. We will review your request and respond accordingly.



Sincerely,
Patricia
[This is Patricia Kelly's card. Their email is pkelly@detroitlandbank.org. Their phone number is +1 313 989 4611. Their phone number is +1 313 974 6869.]<https://hihello.me/p/9d0d28bc-103f-452e-b512-b0312790aa25?referer=email_signature>

WARNING:  This communication (including any attachments) may include, in whole or in part, information protected by the attorney-client privilege, the attorney work product doctrine, the deliberative process privilege, or by other privilege. This communication is confidential and intended solely for receipt by the individual or entity to whom it is addressed.  If you are not the intended recipient, any use of the communication is neither allowed nor intended.  If you receive this email in error, please securely delete the email (including any attachments) and notify the originator that you received the message in error.

communications.communication:

Attached please find a letter from the DLBA notifying you that it is extending the deadline to respond to your November 21, 2024, FOIA request by ten business days.  Please do not hesitate to let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Thank you,





[cid:bbc037ea-be57-4814-be5a-70e830062671]

Thank you and kind regards,


Patricia Kelly

FOIA Coordinator


500 Griswold St, Suite 1200 | Detroit, MI 48226

title: PACKAGE THEFT DATA IN MAJOR METROPOLITAN AREAS

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: PACKAGE THEFT DATA IN MAJOR METROPOLITAN AREAS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Following the Freedom of Information Act, I request access to records related to package theft trends across major U.S. metropolitan areas. Specially, I seek the following:

1. Statistics on reported package thefts from Seattle, San Diego, Los Angeles, New York City, Chicago, Austin, Denver and Portland between January 1, 2019, and the present.
2. Policies and protocols for investigating package theft involving USPS deliveries.
3. Communication or agreements between the USPS Postal Inspection Service and local police departments regarding theft investigations and prevention.
4. Public outreach materials or initiatives addressing package theft prevention.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Abby Feldman

communications.subject: 2025-IGFP-00055 Feldman, Abby Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Dera Ms. Feldman:

This acknowledges receipt of your October 24 Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) to the U.S. Postal Service Office of Inspector General (OIG) request for records related to package theft trends across major U.S. metropolitan areas. Specially, your requested:


  1.  Statistics on reported package thefts from Seattle, San Diego, Los Angeles, New York City, Chicago, Austin, Denver and Portland between January 1, 2019, and the present.
  2.  Policies and protocols for investigating package theft involving USPS deliveries.
  3.  Communication or agreements between the USPS Postal Inspection Service and local police departments regarding theft investigations and prevention.
  4.  Public outreach materials or initiatives addressing package theft prevention.

The OIG FOIA case number shown in the subject line above has been assigned to your request. Your request will be processed in the order it was received.

The FOIA provides agencies 20 working days from receipt to respond to requesters. While this office routinely meets this requirement, current workloads may require additional time to provide our final response.

The FOIA is about records we have in our possession. The FOIA provides only for disclosing federal agency records and does not require government agencies to answer questions, conduct unreasonably burdensome research, or create records. FOIA does not let you appeal any investigative decisions or ask us to research aside from searching for responsive records.

The FOIA sheds light on an agency’s performance of its statutory duties. The FOIA provides that any person has a right, enforceable in court, to obtain access to federal agency records, unless such records (or portions of them) are protected from public disclosure by one of nine exemptions or by one of three special law enforcement record exclusions.

The U.S. Postal Service comprises the Postal Service, the U.S. Postal Inspection Service (USPIS); the Postal Rate Commission (PRC); and the OIG; each with its own area of responsibility and individual FOIA office. This acknowledgment is on behalf of the OIG only.

The Postal Service Records Office establishes procedures to ensure Postal Service records management practices comply with both the FOIA and Privacy Act. The Records Office is the designated custodian for non-law enforcement Postal Service records; including but not limited to contracting and employment/personnel records. Additional information regarding the Postal Service FOIA program can be found at https://about.usps.com/who-we-are/foia/welcome.htm.

The USPIS is the law enforcement, crime prevention, and security arm of USPS, and is the designated custodian for postal records relating to Postal Service law enforcement issues. The USPIS is a federal law enforcement entity charged with enforcing the Federal statutes involving mail fraud, illegal drugs, external mail theft, and other postal crimes, including revenue deficiencies, and are responsible for safety and security of all postal employees and facilities. Additional information regarding the USPIS FOIA program can be found at Terms of Service and Legal | USPIS<https://www.uspis.gov/terms-of-service#freedom-of-information-act>.

The OIG is an independent agency, created in 1997, with oversight authority over audits and investigations of Postal and Inspection Service fraud, abuse, and misconduct. The OIG’s mission is to prevent, detect, and report fraud, theft, and misconduct, and promote efficiency in the operation of the Postal Service.

While the OIG has “oversight authority” for activities of the above referenced entities, the OIG is a separate agency and does not have management authority over the daily operations of either the Postal Service or USPIS. In addition, the OIG FOIA office does not have access to records maintained by the Postal Service or UPSIS and cannot direct either FOIA office to release records under their control. Likewise, the OIG Deputy General Counsel has no authority to review FOIA determinations issued by the Postal Service or USPIS.

Because records related to external mail theft are maintained by the USPIS, we are forwarding a copy of your request to their FOIA office. They will issue a separate FOIA case number and respond to you directly. If you have questions regarding this referral, please contact them via email at foia@uspis.gov<mailto:foia@uspis.gov>, or in writing at:

Office of Counsel
U.S. Postal Inspection Service FOIA/PA Unit
475 L'Enfant Plaza, SW, Room 3301
Washington, DC  20260

Sincerely,

USPS OIG FOIA Team

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Department of Homeland Security for Multimedia Agreements for 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any DHS Multimedia Agreements signed by the Department of Homeland Security for the year 2021.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: RTK 07/17 Butler County ESU c/o District Attorney

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: RTK 07/17 Butler County ESU c/o District Attorney
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A roster of all employees of the Butler County Emergency Services Unit (ESU), including but not limited to first name, last name, position, badge number, salary, and date of hire.
2. All emails, text messages, call logs, and/or other communications among members of the Butler County ESU and between the department and other local, state and federal agencies regarding the rally, held on July 13, 2024, for former President Donald J. Trump at the Butler Farm Show. Please provide communications that occurred any time between January 1, 2024 and the date of this request.
3. All invoices, memoranda of understanding or other such agreements showing and/or describing the services the ESU provided for the rally.
4. All overtime requests submitted by the ESU for hours worked on July 13, 2024 and July 14, 2024.
5. Documents showing active shooter protocols for the ESU, including documents outlining any training department employees have taken in the past five years.


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Danielle Ohl

communications.subject: Your Village of Hanover Park, IL  public records request #24-449 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Village of Hanover Park, IL ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-449 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for contacting the Village of Hanover Park with your request for information pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act. The Freedom of Information Officer for the Village of Hanover Park has determined that your request for records is approved for release.  If you were denied records. You have the right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to:  Leah Bartlett, Public Access Counselor Office of the Illinois Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield IL 62701 Public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by the Circuit Court of Cook, County, Illinois.  If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC.  Sincerely, Kristy Merrill  Village Clerk    ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Village of Hanover Park, IL .

title: Duncan Socrates Lemp Shooting on March 12, 2020

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Duncan Socrates Lemp Shooting on March 12, 2020
communications.communication:
Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Records Related to Duncan Socrates Lemp Shooting on March 12, 2020

To: Montgomery County State’s Attorney’s Office
Montgomery County Circuit Court
50 Maryland Ave.
Rockville, MD 20850

Dear Records Access Officer,

This is a formal request under the Maryland Public Information Act (MPIA) to access all records related to the shooting of Duncan Socrates Lemp on March 12, 2020. As an investigative journalist, I seek these records to ensure public transparency and accountability regarding this significant incident.

Requested Records:

	1.	Body Camera Footage:
	•	All recordings from body-worn cameras of officers present at the scene on March 12, 2020.
	•	Legal Support: ACLU v. Alvarez, 679 F.3d 583 (7th Cir. 2012) affirms the public’s right to record public officials, supporting the disclosure of body camera footage.
	2.	Audio and Video Recordings:
	•	Any additional audio or video recordings, including dashboard camera footage and surveillance footage.
	•	Legal Support: Scott v. United States, 436 U.S. 128 (1978) underscores the public interest in accessing law enforcement communications and recordings for transparency.
	3.	Incident Reports:
	•	All written reports, memos, and briefing documents concerning the shooting incident.
	•	Legal Support: Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989) supports the disclosure of law enforcement records.
	4.	Operational Plans:
	•	Documents detailing strategies and guidelines used by law enforcement during the operation on March 12, 2020.
	•	Legal Support: NLRB v. Robbins Tire & Rubber Co., 437 U.S. 214 (1978) emphasizes the public’s right to understand strategic public authority operations.
	5.	Communications:
	•	All emails, text messages, and other forms of communication among officers, between officers and superiors, and with other relevant parties regarding the incident.
	•	Legal Support: Judicial Watch, Inc. v. U.S. Department of Commerce, 34 F. Supp. 2d 28 (D.D.C. 1998) supports the release of communications to ensure transparency in government operations.
	6.	Evidence:
	•	Any evidence collected at the scene, including photographs, physical evidence logs, and forensic reports.
	•	Legal Support: Electronic Frontier Foundation v. Department of Transportation, 2015 confirms that surveillance footage and related evidence are subject to disclosure under FOIA.
	7.	Details of the No-Knock Warrant and Red Flag Law:
	•	All records, including affidavits, applications, and approvals, related to the decision to serve a no-knock warrant under the Red Flag Law prior to the incident on March 12, 2020.
	•	Legal Support: Giglio v. United States, 405 U.S. 150 (1972) establishes the requirement for the disclosure of exculpatory evidence and details about procedural actions taken by law enforcement.
	•	Legal Support: Illinois v. Gates, 462 U.S. 213 (1983) affirms the importance of transparency in the issuance of search warrants to ensure they are supported by probable cause and comply with constitutional requirements.
	8.	Decision-Making Process and Justification:
	•	Documents and communications that explain the decision-making process and justification for serving the no-knock warrant, including risk assessments and threat analyses.
	•	Legal Support: United States v. Leon, 468 U.S. 897 (1984) emphasizes the need for judicial oversight and transparency in warrant issuance to prevent abuses of power.
	9.	Training and Policies:
	•	Records of any training, guidelines, or policies provided to the officers involved, particularly those related to the execution of no-knock warrants and the use of force.
	•	Legal Support: Tennessee v. Garner, 471 U.S. 1 (1985) underscores the importance of clear policies and training regarding the use of deadly force by law enforcement.

Public Interest Justification:

The requested information is of significant public interest, particularly concerning the transparency of law enforcement activities and the use of force by police officers. Disclosure of these records will promote public understanding and facilitate informed community oversight.

Fees and Document Delivery:

I request a waiver of all fees associated with the processing of this request, as the disclosure serves the public interest significantly and enhances the understanding of government operations without any commercial benefit. I prefer to receive the documents electronically, via email or on a CD-ROM if digital transmission is not feasible.

Response Time and Legal Compliance:

As per the Maryland Public Information Act, I expect a response within the statutory timeframe. Failure to comply with this request may result in legal action to enforce the Act’s provisions. I remind you of your obligation to review this request carefully and to disclose all non-exempt portions of the requested records.

Notice of Publication:

Please be aware that all communications related to this request will be published on a public platform to ensure transparency.

Legal Action:

If necessary, I am prepared to initiate an Article 78 proceeding to compel compliance with the MPIA.

Conclusion:

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and the provision of the requested records in accordance with the Maryland Public Information Act.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter
Investigative Journalist

communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for your request.  I have been looking for records here as well as in Howard County Maryland. Presently, it is my understanding that the records may need to be requested from Howard County but am awaiting confirmation from them.  .Aside from the attached  press releases, it is my understanding that we do not have any additional records.

I will reach out as soon as I hear from Howard County and provide you with the contact information for their MPIA representative.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you,



Virginia Mumford

Senior Legal Assistant

State's Attorney's Office

50 Maryland Ave 5th Floor

Rockville MD 20850

Phone: 240-777-7412

title: Threat Index - Shinzo Abe

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Threat Index - Shinzo Abe
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For  US Department of State’s Diplomatic Security Service

I was seeking any records in your custody in relation to potential threats of assassination to the Former Japanese Prime Minster Shinzo Abe for the dates: 01/01/2022 to the current date.

I was also seeking any records in your custody related to the Former Prime Minister based on the announcement of his untimely murder.

The former prime minister was assassinated on 070822 during a speech in NARA.

Areas to search:
All available indices related to subject matter. 

Please release records on a rolling basis and include any future records added or cross-referenced to the subject until the request is completed.

EFOIA Request

Vaughn index is requested for any records claimed for exemption.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes

Request for fee waiver: Category Media public interest

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

communications.subject: Ref: F-2022-10263, Freedom of Information Act Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
**THIS EMAIL BOX IS NOT MONITORED, PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL.** Mr.Fernandes: This email acknowledgesreceipt of your July 11, 2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. §552) request received by the U.S. Department ofState, Office of Information Programs and Services on July 11, 2022, regarding any records in relation to potential threats of assassination to the Former Japanese Prime Minster Shinzo Abe for the dates: 01/01/2022 to the current date. Also, records related to the Former Prime Minister based on the announcement of his untimely murder.  Request is for release records on a rolling basis and include any future records added or cross-referenced to the subject until the request is completed (Date Range for Record Search: From 1/1/2022 To 7/11/2022).  Unless you advise otherwise, we will treat as non-responsive any compilations of publicly available news reports and any publicly available documents not created by the U.S. government, such as mass-distribution emails from news media.  This Office assigned your request the subject reference number and placed it in the complex processing track where it will beprocessed as quickly as possible. See 22CFR § 171.11(h). 
Yourequested a waiver for all fees associated with the processing of yourrequest. Please be advised this Officewill make a determination regarding a fee waiver at a later date. 
This Office willnot be able to respond within the 20 days provided by the statute due to“unusual circumstances.” See 5 U.S.C. §552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii). In this instance,the unusual circumstances include the need to search for and collect requestedrecords from other Department offices or Foreign Service posts. If you have any questions regarding yourrequest , would like to narrow the scope or arrange analternative time frame to speed its processing, or would like an estimated dateof completion, please contact our FOIA Requester Service Center or our FOIAPublic Liaison by email at FOIAstatus@state.gov or telephone at202-261-8484.  Additionally, youmay contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at theNational Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIAmediation services they offer. Thecontact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government InformationServices, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS,College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, email at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. **THIS EMAIL BOX IS NOT MONITORED, PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL.**

The Department has a backlog of FOIA requests, and there will be a delay in processing FOIA requests.  As the Department continues to work through its backlog of FOIA requests, it is mindful of its accountability to the public and is processing this request as quickly as possible.


In response to your inquiry, the FOIA Requester Service Center contacted the Bureau of Diplomatic Security and was advised that your request is in process.  At this time, the estimated date of completion (EDC) is January 26, 2024.  Please note that EDCs are estimates and are subject to change.
If you have any concerns or questions regarding a FOIA-related matter, please send an email to the FOIA Requester Service Center at foiastatus@state.gov<mailto:foiastatus@state.gov>.

We truly appreciate your continued patience and also apologize for the delayed response.

Sincerely,

U.S. Department of State
FOIA Requester Service Center





SENSITIVE BUT UNCLASSIFIED

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sir/Madam: This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I request that a copy of the following document(s) be provided to me:  All records, Investigations, notes, and emails, regarding the FLSA & Pump Act, Department of Labor investigation of Ascension St John Medical Center, located at 1923 S Utica Ave, Tulsa, OK 74104 and 7501 Riverside Pkwy, Tulsa, OK 74136 for the time period/year of 01JAN24 to 09SEP24.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nate

title: Alameda County DA - Berkeley Scanner (Alameda County District Attorney)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Alameda County DA - Berkeley Scanner (Alameda County District Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports state that independent journalist Emilie Raguso was barred from a recent press conference:

https://twitter.com/berkeleyscanner/status/1729941721923121526?s=46

Therefore, I request the following:

Any emails, documents, or policy papers mentioning "The Berkeley Scanner" or "Emilie Raguso" or "berkeleyscanner.com" from October 1, 2023 until the time this request is processed.

The documents will be used in the course of reporting by 404 Media, an independent tech journalism outlet.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

communications.subject: Re: California Public Records Act Request: Alameda County DA - Berkeley Scanner (Alameda County District Attorney) (Index 3390)
communications.communication:
RE: Your CPRA Request dated December 5, 2023 (Index 3390)



We are responding to your California Public Records Act (CPRA) request received by email on December 5, 2023. You are seeking "any emails, documents, or policy papers mentioning 'The Berkeley Scanner' or 'Emilie Raguso' or 'berkeleyscanner.com'" from October 1, 2023 to December 5, 2023.



We have enclosed a document responsive to your request.  Regarding your request for emails, we will consult our County IT Department to extract potentially relevant correspondence using a word search and to review them for potential exemptions or privileges. This process can take substantial time.



Regarding your request for policy papers, we have no responsive documents.



We will give you a production update on January 31, 2024.


Very truly yours,

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Elixir Labs Contract for Oregon Provider Management and Payment Platform
communications.communication:
Good morning Toni,

We received an email request via the platform Muckrock for a public records request. The following was the body of the email:

“Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:
Contract awarded to Elixir Labs from the Provider Management Platform RFP, #S-58100-00007532.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.”

DELC’s public record request form can be found here: Department of Early Learning and Care : Contact Us : About Us : State of Oregon<https://www.oregon.gov/delc/about-us/pages/contact-us.aspx> .
The are also separate instructions for alternate submission forms. DELC’s public records request system allows us to accurately track and communicate regarding requests and the back and forth regarding the request. I look forward to hearing from you or seeing your submission soon.

In accordance with ORS 192.324(4)(a), the public body may establish fees reasonably calculated to reimburse the public body for the public body’s actual cost of making public records available, including costs for summarizing, compiling, or tailoring the public records, either in organization or media, to meet the request.

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best wishes,
[A picture containing graphics, cartoon  Description automatically generated]
Madison Buck (She/Her)​
Department of Early Learning and Care​
Public Records and Communication Specialist
DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov<mailto:DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov>
Website: Oregon.gov/DELC<https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/4T6sCW6qNgs52KYX8Ix6GqA?domain=oregon.gov>​
Connect with DELC: Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/OREarlyLearning/> | Instagram<https://www.instagram.com/OREarlyLearning/> | YouTube<https://www.youtube.com/@OREarlyLearning> | LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/company/OREarlyLearning/>

The Oregon Department of Early Learning and Care (DELC) fosters coordinated, culturally appropriate, and family-centered services that recognize and respect the strengths of children, families and early learning and care professionals. Our vision is that all children, families, early care and education professionals, and communities are supported and empowered to thrive.

communications.subject: RE: Public Records Request Inquiry 908
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

This is to conclude DELC’s response to your request date 12/03/2024 at 4:36 PM. Attached are three documents and one excel file.

Some of the information you’ve requested is exempt from disclosure pursuant to the following:

  *   ORS 192.345 Subsection (27): Information provided to, obtained by or used by a public body to authorize, originate, receive or authenticate a transfer of funds, including but not limited to a credit card number, payment card expiration date, password, financial institution account number and financial institution routing number
  *   ORS 192.377: A public body that is the custodian of or is otherwise in possession of information that was submitted to the public body in confidence and is not otherwise required by law to be submitted.
Please let me know if you have any concerns or questions regarding the records. Thank you and have a wonderful day.

Best wishes,
[A picture containing graphics, cartoon  Description automatically generated]
Madison Buck (She/Her)​

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: SFD Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The "Final Report" for all internal investigations in which the named employees were alleged to have violated "Social Media Policy for Local 27 Members – Hate Speech", whether sustained or not, since January 1, 2019.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C200123-100624
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C200123-100624 received on October 06, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C200123-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C200123-100624. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C200123-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Fire - General :: C200123-100624
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Rose Terse, 
The final report for the one investigation that is responsive to your request is now available to download in response to your request C200123-100624. Myself and several members of our HR staff went through all of our investigative records since 2019, and the investigation into former employee Steve Collins was the only investigation where the Social Media Policy was actually implicated. 
To download  the report: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C200123-100624. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your record as you may only download it from the system three times. If you do not download your record within 30 days of request closure, the link to your record will expire. 
The Seattle Fire Department has now provided the responsive records. We consider your request closed and plan to take no further action to fulfill this request. If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days after downloading your records, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Evan Ward 
Public Disclosure Officer 
Seattle Fire Department

title: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all contracts and/or grant agreements between City of Detroit departments or budgeted units, and fiscal sponsors (which are sometimes also referred to as fiscal intermediaries or nonprofit fiduciaries) since 2018.  

For context, Office of Chief Financial Officer Communications Manager Stephanie Davis said a nonprofit fiduciary is a philanthropic group city departments use to send funds for a particular initiative or purpose. Those funds are tied to a grant agreement outlining the duration, terms, etc. of the work. 

For example, the Mayor's Office-Mobility uses Eastside Community Network as a fiscal sponsor.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laura Herberg

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on August 1, 2024. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, August 2, 2024.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before August 23, 2024.

Your request is being handled by Amanda Kelly. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Amanda Kelly at kellya@detroitmi.gov<mailto:kellya@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.

title: Agency Roster (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department)

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Public Record Request Submitted for Public Record Request - Marcus Boyd
communications.communication:
Hello Marcus Boyd,

Public Record Request Title


Public Record Request - Marcus Boyd  


Public Record Request #


NPR2024-0069977 


Name of Requestor


Marcus Boyd 


Status


Submitted 


Request Submitted Date


11/25/2024 5:00 PM 






Your Public Record Service Request has been successfully submitted. You will be notified by email if more information or payment is required and when your request is completed. The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department - Public Records Unit hours of operation are 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday, excluding holidays, Juneteenth, Nevada Day, the day after Thanksgiving and December 24th.  Any public record requests made outside of normal business hours will be deemed received the next business day. At any time, you may monitor the status of your request by logging into your Public Records portal account.

***Please note that holidays that fall on a Saturday or Sunday will be observed the preceding Friday or the following Monday. There are 13 holidays that LVMPD observes throughout the year. Based on this information, adjust your request accordingly.

Public Request Portal | Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (lvmpd.com)<https://www.lvmpd.com/i-want-to/file/public-request-portal>

Thank you,

Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department
400 S. Martin L. King Boulevard
Las Vegas, Nevada  89106
702-828-7489
Monday-Friday 8am to 5pm

The records you seek are not readily available and would be unduly
burdensome to gather, compile, redact, and produce. A public entity need not produce records that are not readily available and
would require research, compilation and redaction to produce. See Lunney v.
State, 418 P.3d 943, 954 (Ariz. Ct. App. 2017) (recognizing that the agency was
not required to respond to the burdensome request); Shehadeh v. Madigan, 996
N.E.2d 1243, 1249 (Ill. App. Ct. 2013) (holding that the Attorney General
satisfied its burden by explaining that its staff members would have to go
through all of the 9,200 potentially responsive documents by hand); Beckett v.
Serpas, 112 So.3d 348, 353 (La. App. Ct. 2013) (determining that segregating
10-years worth of files is unreasonably burdensome); Community Youth Athletic
Ctr. v. City of Nat’l City, 164 Cal.Rptr.3d 644, 676, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1425
(2013) (generally, an agency is not required to undertake extraordinarily
extensive or intrusive searches, and in general, the scope of an agency’s search
for public records need only be reasonably calculated to locate responsive
documents) .

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Institute for Curriculum Services (Colorado Department of Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any contracts between the  Education Department and the Institute for Curriculum Services, and the content of any professional development materials or presentations prepared by the Institute Curriculum Services for the Education Department since October 7th, 2022. I also request any email communication between Education Department employees and employees of the Institute for Curriculum Services since October 7th, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alex Kane

communications.communication:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out Colorado Department of Education Open Records  
Request Form
Here's what was received.


Colorado Department of Education Open Records Request Form

Please use this form to submit requests for records under the Colorado Open  
Records Act. You will receive a copy of your submission to the email  
address that you provide.

A request is considered "received" by CDE on the working day that it is  
submitted. Any request received after 4:30 pm or any day CDE is officially  
closed will be considered received as of the following working day. CDE  
shall make every effort to respond within three working days, as provided  
by § 24-72-203(3)(b), CRS This three-day period begins on the first working  
day following receipt of the request.

The following is an example of a response timeline assuming that there are  
no holidays:

If a request is received before 4:30 pm on Tuesday, the three-day period  
would begin at 8 am on Wednesday and end at 5 pm on Friday.

If a request is received after 4:30 pm on Tuesday, the three-day period  
would begin at 8 am on Thursday and end at 5 pm on the following Monday.

The department may extend its response period up to seven working days if  
it finds extenuating circumstances exist and communicates that finding to  
the requestor in writing, as described in § 24-72-203(3)(b), CRS The  
extension period would begin on the fourth working day following receipt of  
the request.

Visit the CDE website for more information about our CORA policy and  
process.

communications.subject: Confirmation of receipt of CORA: Institute for Curriculum Services: Records
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon, Alex Kane-

Our procedure outlines how to properly submit a request to The Colorado Department of Education (link below):

https://www.cde.state.co.us/communications/corapolicy#procedureforrequests

To better assist you with future requests you can use the below form  (link provided):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSflZBlLha8J7Ezhxv8YfcRacQMP2qc7GekNeLdSpXSEmHLT8g/viewform

We have received your Monday, November 25th 2024 open records request seeking:

To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: Any contracts between the Education Department and the Institute for Curriculum Services, and the content of any professional development materials or presentations prepared by the Institute Curriculum Services for the Education Department since October 7th, 2022. I also request any email communication between Education Department employees and employees of the Institute for Curriculum Services since October 7th, 2022. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Alex Kane


A request is considered "received" by the Colorado Department of Education the day an e-mail, fax or letter containing a request is opened. A request received after 4:30 p.m. or any day CDE is officially closed will be considered received as of the following working day.

CDE shall make every effort to respond within three working days, as provided by § 24-72-203(3)(b), C.R.S. The three-working-day response time begins the first working day following receipt of the request.  NOTE: CDE will be closed Wednesday 27th through Friday, November 29th 2024.  We will reopen on Monday, December 2nd , 2024.  Your open records request will be due by the end of the day Monday, December 2nd 2024

The department may extend its response period up to seven working days if it finds extenuating circumstances exist and communicates that finding to the requestor in writing, as described in § 24-72-203(3)(b), C.R.S.

If you have further questions about CDE's Colorado Open Records Act policy, you can find information here: https://www.cde.state.co.us/communications/corapolicy

For additional questions, please contact Communications Director Jeremy Meyer at meyer_jeremy@cde.state.co.us<mailto:meyer_jeremy@cde.state.co.us>.


Marco Ramirez

Communications Division
P 720.237.8994

Good morning,

We are currently working on your open records request. In order to search our email database for correspondence with employees from the Institute for Curriculum Services, we will need you to provide the user name and/or the domain name. For example, in the email address "billyjoe@happycompany.com", "billyjoe" is the username, "happycompany" is the domain name, and ".com" is the extension.

Additionally, we have emails going back only 13 months from the current date. We will continue processing your request when we receive this information.

Thank you.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Emails, Talent
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from Ben Felton, from April 1, 2023 through current with the following constraints:

keywords

"Brandon Johnson"
or
"conflict of interest"
or
"Mayor Johnson"

Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Femails-talent-176548%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tDcEV%3A3zR86cflDzMQu_ydj2o2i8pKJI7H8XxFnTBdtw9tbpg 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
12/05/2024 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N016513-111924 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

A log of all emails to/from Ben Felton, from April 1, 2023 through current with the following constraints: 

keywords 

"Brandon Johnson" 
or 
"conflict of interest" 
or 
"Mayor Johnson" 

Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Femails-talent-176548%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tDcEV%3A3zR86cflDzMQu_ydj2o2i8pKJI7H8XxFnTBdtw9tbpg 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. Section 7(1)(f) exempts from release “Preliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body.” [5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(f)]. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

If you have received this message in error, be advised that any review, disclosure, use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this message or its contents is strictly prohibited. Please notify us immediately by reply email that you have received this message in error, and destroy this message, including any attachments.

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails with subject lines beginning with the exact phrase "PDR Review" sent and received by the Mayor's Office since January 1, 2024, including attachments and associated metadata. Please only provide one copy of emails sent/received by multiple people in the Mayor's Office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C199770-100224
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C199770-100224 received on October 02, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C199770-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C199770-100224. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C199770-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Emails with subject lines beginning with the exact phrase "PDR Review" sent and received by the Mayor's Office since January 1, 2024, including attachments and associated metadata. Please only provide one copy of emails sent/received by multiple people in the Mayor's Office. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Foffice-of-the-mayor-241%252Fpdr-review-2024-174036%252F%253Femail%253DStacy.Irwin%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj9sYRrCpZzSYtO2LZl3Hncb4%3A1swA6J%3ApSZW0F4Y8nD17RByR18zNb2sd1k1n9J18hp-EQKOn_c 
The records being made available to you at this time include the following: Installment 1 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C199770-100224. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
We have not prepared a detailed exemption log, as only limited information has been redacted from the responsive records. The information normally provided in an exemption log, such as title, author, recipient, subject, and number of pages, is readily ascertainable from looking at the redacted records. Redactions have been applied throughout the documents pursuant to the following exemption: Installment #1, 2024.11.18 installment - Ex.01A-Attorney-Client Privileged Communications - RCW 42.56.070 and 5.60.060 - Records reflect communication between a client and an attorney for the purpose of seeking or providing legal advice. 
The other records/attachments and native files are from different requests with "PDR Review" in the title and also include their own exemption logs and are being provided to you. 
The Mayor's Office has now provided all responsive records. We consider your request closed and plan to take no further action to fulfill this request. If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days after downloading your records, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Sincerely, 
Tracie Cantrell

The records being made available to you at this time include the following: Installment 1 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C200789-101024. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
The Mayor's Office has now provided all responsive records. We consider your request closed and plan to take no further action to fulfill this request. If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days after downloading your records, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Sincerely, 
Tracie Cantrell

title: Agency Roster (Ventura Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (Ventura Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: ICE Monthly Budget Spreadsheets

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICE Monthly Budget Spreadsheets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the #DetentionKills Network and its fiscal sponsor, Al Otro Lado, I hereby request finalized copies of ICE's monthly budget spreadsheet for ICE's custody management operations. This spreadsheet is likely to be maintained by the Director, the Executive Assistance Director for the Custody Management Division, and the Office of Acquisition Management, among other offices. I request these spreadsheets for each month during the FY17, FY18, FY19, FY20, and FY21 budget years.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free
